input: A difficult Putnam question with an elegant solution.
translatedText: 一个困难的普特南问题，有一个优雅的解决方案。

input: This video was sponsored by Brilliant: https://brilliant.org/3b1b
translatedText: 该视频由 Brilliant 赞助：https://brilliant.org/3b1b

input: An equally valuable form of support is to simply share some of the videos.
translatedText: 另一种同样有价值的支持形式是分享一些视频。

input: Special thanks to these supporters: http://3b1b.co/putnam-thanks
Solution to the puzzle mentioned at the end: https://brilliant.org/3b1bindicator/
translatedText: 最后提到的难题的解决方案：https://brilliant.org/3b1bindicator/

input: These videos exist thanks to Patreon:
translatedText: 这些视频的存在要感谢 Patreon：

input: A different write-up of this solution:
translatedText: 该解决方案的不同写法：
1992 年 Putnam 提出了这个问题：

input: A problem with a similar flavor came up on the 2005 Putnam A6.  Give it a try!  The solution for that problem, by the way, was written by Calvin Lin, a friend of mine who works at Brilliant.  Small world!
translatedText: 2005 年的 Putnam A6 也出现了类似味道的问题。试一试！顺便说一句，这个问题的解决方案是由我在 Brilliant 工作的朋友 Calvin Lin 编写的。小世界！
